comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
I know I ask this every time, but do we really need all this XML config, or what is the reason for it? There is no comment indicating why this is needed for the leave request tab. Previously it was issue with multi paint, but that is not on the leave reqeust tab, as far as I know.
Adding XML like this sohuld be last option...

comments.comment: They want to have the same functionality as for the ADT's test page in Absence Reason Management to run the Plan adjudication. Oddysey needs all these information.

Rename to LeaveRequestInformationTabWidget, widgets should start with the main BO. Rename test also.
Name is actually not very clear, why isnt it called LeaveRequestDetailsTabWidget, if it is showing the LeaveRequestDetailsWidget? "Informqation" is not really a common word for widget names.

Rename to just LeaveRequestTabStripWidget and rename getters, test also etc.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Javadoc gives no info other than the class name, so its kinda pointless :) Javadoc should describe what this widget shows, where its used, what employer does it expect etc.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Not convinced about this whole widget. Lots of crossing over with what Hugo has done. I dont think our approach here is correct.

comments.author: Alberto Galende
comments.comment: After our talk this is going to change, we have to show an existing widget (and hopefully will fill the AC).

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Again, why do you use "this." here, and not in getOrganisation()? Pick one approach.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: addNewEntryLabel doesnt make sense as the ID, as we will never be adding a new value here. Rename to "NoEmployerHelpText

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
I dont think we should be doing this here, or like this.
This employer/occupation information is tied in with what Hugo is doing and we should not be creating fields like this in an absence widget.
Half of the info here is just an address, we shouldnt be painting label/value for this, we should be painting an address widget. We need to speak with Hugo, Gareth about the whole approach to employer/occupation info.

comments.author: Alberto Galende
comments.comment: After our talk this is going to change, we have to show an existing widget (and hopefully will fill the AC).

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
This should be an expectation, so you can specify a return value, and then replace the notNull() farther down with
assertThat(employerDetailsWidget.getOrganisation(), is(organisation));

comments.comment: Is this used ?

comments.author: Tom Gurrie

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: This should live on a page object as it's starting point is a specific point on a page

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: This is beginning to get complicated - might see if we can structure it differently

comments.author: Vinod Geeachan
comments.comment: Sure, we can improve it

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: Is there a need for this step ? I think we should investigate being able to click on a step title to navigate to the particular step. This way, if new steps are added we don't need to refactor the order of clicks

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: could this test be combined with the previous ? I think it's using existing FDP functionality so might not warrant a test on its own

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: need for this step ?

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: This probably needs a bit of restructuring. It's not an Intake step in its own right. Confusion could arise if it lives alongside the other 'steps'

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: Have you taken this back into Absence, as opposed to the claims version ?
